row.title: Breast Changes and Conditions
row.field_page_description: Breast changes include benign conditions and those that increase the risk of breast cancer. Symptoms and treatment of breast conditions such as ADH, ALH, cysts, DCIS, and LCIS are explained to women who may have received an abnormal mammogram finding.
row.field_feature_card_description: Including changes that are benign (not cancer) and those that may increase a woman’s risk of cancer.
row.field_list_description: Breast changes and conditions such as adenosis, ADH, ALH, cysts, DCIS, duct ectasia, fat necrosis, fibrocystic breast changes, fibroadenomas, and LCIS are explained, together with information about how these conditions are found, diagnosed, and treated.

row.title: Tackling Cancer Health Disparities: Small Steps, Big Hopes
row.field_page_description: An article about steps for developing and testing ways to reduce—or eliminate—cancer-related health disparities.
row.field_feature_card_description: An article about steps for developing and testing ways to reduce—or eliminate—cancer-related health disparities.
row.field_list_description: Numerous studies have documented disparities in cancer incidence and mortality among certain populations. But, by and large, cancer-related health disparities in the United States have been an intractable problem. Researchers believe the time is now ripe for actively developing and testing ways to reduce—or better yet, eliminate—these disparities.
row.field_browser_title: Tackling Cancer Health Disparities: Small Steps, Big Hopes

row.field_page_description: Cancer treatment can cause late side effects that may not show up for months or years after treatment. These late effects may include heart and lung problems, bone loss, eye and hearing changes, lymphedema, and other problems

row.title: Precision Medicine in Cancer Treatment

International Cancer Screening Network
row.field_page_description: The International Cancer Screening Network promotes evidence-based cancer screening implementation and evaluation with cooperation from multilateral organizations around the globe. Learn more about how ICSN aims to reduce the global burden of cancer by supporting research and international collaboration.
row.field_list_description: The International Cancer Screening Network (ICSN) is a consortium of countries, organizations, and experts working towards reducing the global cancer burden through context-specific, evidence-based cancer screening programs.

row.title: External Beam Radiation Therapy for Cancer
row.field_page_description: External beam radiation therapy is used to treat many types of cancer. it is a local treatment, where a machine aims radiation at your cancer. Learn more about different types of external beam radiation therapy, and what to expect if you're receiving treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: This type of cancer treatment comes from a machine that aims radiation at a specifc part of your body.
row.field_list_description: External beam radiation therapy comes from a machine that aims radiation at your cancer. It is a local treatment, which means it treats a specific part of your body. External beam radiation therapy is used to treat many types of cancer.
row.field_browser_title: External Beam Radiation Therapy for Cancer

row.title: Brachytherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: When getting brachytherapy, a solid source of radiation is put inside your body. It can be used treat different kinds of cancer, head and neck, breast, cervix, prostate, and eye. Learn more about how what to expect when getting internal radiation therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: Brachytherapy is a type of internal radiation therapy used to treat a variety of cancers.
row.field_list_description: In brachytherapy, a solid source of radiation is placed inside your body, in or near a tumor. It is often used to treat cancers of the head and neck, breast, cervix, prostate, and eye.

row.title: Radiation Therapy Side Effects
row.field_page_description: Radiation therapy has side effects because it not only kills or slows the growth of cancer cells, it can also affect nearby healthy cells. Many people who get radiation therapy experience fatigue. Other side effects depend on the part of the body that is being treated. Learn more about possible side effects.
row.field_list_description: Radiation not only kills or slows the growth of cancer cells, it can also affect nearby healthy cells. Damage to healthy cells can cause side effects. Many people who get radiation therapy experience fatigue. Other side effects depend on the part of the body that is being treated.

row.title: Sorafenib Improves Progression-Free Survival in Some Patients with Metastatic Thyroid Cancer
row.field_short_title: Sorafenib Improves Progression-Free Survival in Some Patients with Metastatic Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared sorafenib (Nexavar®) and a placebo for the treatment of locally advanced or metastatic differentiated thyroid cancer that is no longer responding to treatment with radioactive iodine
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from an international phase III trial show that sorafenib (Nexavar®) may benefit patients with locally advanced or metastatic differentiated thyroid cancer that is no longer responding to treatment with radioactive iodine. Patients who were treat
row.field_list_description: Results from an international phase III trial show that sorafenib (Nexavar®) may benefit patients with locally advanced or metastatic differentiated thyroid cancer that is no longer responding to treatment with radioactive iodine. Patients who were treated with sorafenib lived longer without their cancers getting worse than patients who received a placebo.

row.title: Lung-MAP: Master Protocol for Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Lung-MAP: Master Protocol for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: The Lung Cancer Master Protocol, or Lung-MAP, is a precision medicine research study for people with advanced non-small cell lung cancer that has continued to grow after treatment. Patients are assigned to different study drug combinations based on the results of genomic profiling of their tumors.

row.title: Create an Adult Immunotherapy Network
row.field_page_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to establish an adult cancer immunotherapy network to develop immune-based approaches for the treatment and prevention of cancer in adult patients and discover why immunotherapy is effective in some patients but not in others.

row.title: Minimize Cancer Treatment’s Debilitating Side Effects
row.field_page_description: Cancer Moonshot initiative to develop a better system for monitoring and managing patient-reported side effects, in an effort to minimize debilitating side effects and reduce cancer costs related to poorly controlled symptoms.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients may abandon their effective cancer treatments due to debilitating side effects. Guidelines for routine monitoring can minimize harmful symptoms.
row.field_list_description: Accelerate the development of guidelines for routine monitoring and management of patient reported symptoms to minimize debilitating side effects of cancer and its treatment.

row.title: Anemia and Cancer Treatment

row.title: NCI Awardee Skills Development Consortium: Research Education Short Courses (UE5)
row.field_page_description: The NASDC UE5 FOA is for Research Education Short Courses that are innovative and include state-of-the-art, evidence-based scientific and/or educational content that is essential to meet the academic career development needs of current NCI-funded junior faculty investigators.
row.field_list_description: The NCI Awardee Skills Development Consortium (NASDC) UE5 goal is to provide Short Course opportunities for current NCI grantees, especially those who are junior faculty to enhance their skills in areas that are critical for establishing and maintaining successful independent academic cancer research careers.

row.title: NCI Awardee Skills Development Consortium: Program Logistics and Evaluation Coordinating Center (U24)

row.title: Colonoscopy Reduces Risk of Death from Colorectal Cancer in High-Risk Patients

row.title: Relieving Mouth Sores from Cancer Treatment: The Discovery of Palifermin

row.title: Combination of Obinutuzumab Plus Chlorambucil Improves Survival in Patients with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia and Other Health Conditions

row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized phase III trial, previously untreated patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and other health conditions who received a combination of obinutuzumab (Gazyva™) and chlorambucil (Leukeran®) lived longer without their
row.field_list_description: In an international randomized phase III trial, previously untreated patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia and other health conditions who received a combination of obinutuzumab (Gazyva™) and chlorambucil (Leukeran®) lived longer without their disease getting worse (progression-free survival) and had better overall survival than patients who received chlorambucil alone.

row.title: About The Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG)
row.field_page_description: The Center for Cancer Genomics applies next-generation sequencing and genomic analysis to identify genetic drivers of cancer and produce data for researchers.
row.field_list_description: The Center for Cancer Genomics uses cancer genomic techniques such as next-generation sequencing to better diagnose and treat cancer patients. The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) and the Office of Cancer Genomics (OCG) are both part of CCG.

row.title: Cancer Genomics Overview
row.field_page_description: Cancer genomics uses technologies such as sequencing to identify DNA and RNA alterations, define molecular subtypes, and develop precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_list_description: Cancer is caused by changes to the cell’s DNA. Cancer genomics uses technologies such as sequencing to identify genetic alterations, define molecular subtypes, and develop precision medicine approaches for cancer treatment.

row.title: Cancer Prevention Research
row.field_page_description: NCI’s prevention research has a broad focus, from identifying environmental and lifestyle factors that influence cancer risk to studying the biology of how cancer develops and studying ways to disseminate prevention interventions.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI-supported scientists are studying cancer risk, cancer biology, prevention interventions, and more.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s prevention research has a broad focus, from identifying environmental and lifestyle factors that influence cancer risk to studying the biology of how cancer develops and studying ways to disseminate prevention interventions.

row.title: Step 1: Application Development & Submission
row.field_page_description: There are nine research grant application types, each with specific procedures. Learn more about developing, submitting, and tracking a cancer research grant application.

row.field_list_description: There are nine research grant application types, each with specific procedures and required documentation. Learn more about developing, submitting, and tracking a grant application.

row.field_page_description: Information on the assignment numbers the Center for Scientific Review (CSR) creates once an application is submitted and other submission policies.
row.field_feature_card_description: After you develop and submit your application, the Center for Scientific Review (CSR) will assign your application to an Institute or Center (IC) at NIH based on the focus and mission of the IC.
row.field_list_description: Information on the assignment numbers the Center for Scientific Review (CSR) creates once an application is submitted and other submission policies.

row.title: Fatigue and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Fatigue is a common side effect of many cancer treatments such as chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, and surgery. Anemia and pain can also cause fatigue. Learn about symptoms and way to manage fatigue.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes cancer-related fatigue, a side effect of some cancer treatments. Symptoms and ways to manage fatigue during cancer treatment is also covered.

row.title: Treating High-grade Lesions to Prevent Anal Cancer in HIV-infected People
row.field_short_title: Treating High-grade Lesions to Prevent Anal Cancer in HIV-infected People
row.field_page_description: This study, called the ANCHOR trial, will investigate whether screening and prevention methods similar to those used to prevent cervical cancer can help prevent anal cancer in HIV-infected men and women.
row.field_feature_card_description: This study will investigate whether certain screening and prevention methods can help prevent anal cancer in HIV-infected men and women.
row.field_list_description: This study, called the ANCHOR trial, will investigate whether screening and prevention methods similar to those used to prevent cervical cancer can help prevent anal cancer in HIV-infected men and women.

row.title: Step 4: Award Negotiation & Issuance
row.field_page_description: Before a grant can be awarded and accepted, several pre-award activities must happen to formalize the partnership. Ensuring compliance with federal laws, a review of costs and a negotiation of the appropriate funding level must all happen in order to receive a grant.
row.field_feature_card_description: When an agency awards a grant, it is formalizing its partnership with the recipient (institution) to ensure compliance with federal laws, regulations and policies, and to protect the overall scientific endeavor.
row.field_list_description: Before a grant can be awarded and accepted, several pre-award activities must happen to formalize the partnership. Ensuring compliance with federal laws, a review of costs and a negotiation of the appropriate funding level must all happen in order to receive a grant.

row.title: Age and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Advancing age is the most important risk factor for cancer overall, and for many individual cancer types.
row.field_list_description: Advancing age is the most important risk factor for cancer overall, and for many individual cancer types.

row.title: Diet
row.field_page_description: Information about certain foods, minerals, and other parts of a person's diet and their associations with reducing or increasing the risk of cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Scientists have studied many dietary components to see if they raise or lower the risk of cancer.
row.field_list_description: Information about certain foods, minerals, and other parts of a person's diet and their associations with reducing or increasing the risk of cancer.

row.title: Hormones
row.field_page_description: information about the female hormones that are associated with an increased risk of certain cancers.
row.field_list_description: information about the female hormones that are associated with an increased risk of certain cancers.

row.title: Infectious Agents
row.field_page_description: Certain infectious agents, including viruses, bacteria, and parasites, can cause cancer in infected people or increase the risk that cancer will form.
row.field_list_description: Certain infectious agents, including viruses, bacteria, and parasites, can cause cancer in infected people or increase the risk that cancer will form.

row.title: Radiation
row.field_page_description: Radiation of certain wavelengths, called ionizing radiation, has enough energy to damage DNA and cause cancer. Ionizing radiation includes radon, x-rays, gamma rays, and other forms of high-energy radiation.
row.field_list_description: Radiation of certain wavelengths, called ionizing radiation, has enough energy to damage DNA and cause cancer. Ionizing radiation includes radon, x-rays, gamma rays, and other forms of high-energy radiation.

row.title: Sunlight
row.field_page_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes early aging and skin damage that can lead to skin cancer. Find information, including tips, on how to protect your skin.
row.field_feature_card_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes damage that can lead to skin cancer.
row.field_list_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes damage that can lead to skin cancer.

row.title: Legal Requirements
row.field_page_description: Research grants are subject to many requirements from a variety of legal authorities, with the broadest being the U.S. Constitution.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the legal requirements research grants are subject to.
row.field_list_description: Research grants are subject to many requirements from a variety of legal authorities, with the broadest being the U.S. Constitution.
row.meta_keywords: Research grants are subject to many requirements from a variety of legal authorities, with the broadest being the U.S. Constitution.

row.title: Tobacco
row.field_page_description: Tobacco use is a leading cause of cancer and of death from cancer. Find resources on the harms of tobacco use and how to get help quitting.
row.field_feature_card_description: Tobacco use is a leading cause of cancer and of death from cancer.
row.field_list_description: Tobacco use is a leading cause of cancer and of death from cancer. Find resources on the harms of tobacco use and how to get help quitting.

row.title: Immunotherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Immunotherapy is treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer. Get information about the different types of immunotherapy and what you can expect during treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Immunotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer.
row.field_list_description: Immunotherapy is a type of treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer. Get information about the types of immunotherapy and what you can expect during treatment.

row.title: Stem Cell Transplants in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants and side effects that may occur.
row.field_feature_card_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants and side effects that may occur.
row.field_list_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants, side effects that may occur, and how stem cell transplants are used in cancer treatment.
row.field_browser_title: Stem Cell Transplants in Cancer Treatment

row.title: Cancer Biology Research
row.field_page_description: The broad base of knowledge created by studying the differences between normal cells and cancer cells has been critical to progress against the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studying the differences between normal cells and cancer cells is critical to progress against the disease.
row.field_list_description: The broad base of knowledge created by studying the differences between normal cells and cancer cells has been critical to progress against the disease.

row.title: Research on Causes of Cancer
row.field_page_description: Understanding the exposures and risk factors that cause cancer, as well as the genetic abnormalities associated with the disease, has helped us to reduce certain exposures and to ameliorate their harmful effects.
row.field_feature_card_description: Research to understand the risk factors and mutations associated with cancer is vital to reducing cancer's harmful effects.
row.field_list_description: Understanding the exposures and risk factors that cause cancer, as well as the genetic abnormalities associated with the disease, has helped us to reduce certain exposures and to ameliorate their harmful effects.

row.title: Cancer Diagnosis Research
row.field_page_description: Accurate information derived from diagnostic tools is critical for making decisions at all stages of cancer care. NCI supports research on the development of tests and imaging technologies that can provide specific information about an individual’s cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI supports research on the development of tests and imaging technologies vital to progress against cancer.
row.field_list_description: Accurate information derived from diagnostic tools is critical for making decisions at all stages of cancer care. NCI supports research on the development of tests and imaging technologies that can provide specific information about an individual’s cancer.

row.title: Cancer Health Disparities Research
row.field_page_description: NCI is addressing cancer health disparities through its efforts in basic research, community-level programs, and more.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is working to understand and address cancer health disparities, such as the higher cancer death rates, less frequent use of proven screening tests, and higher rates of advanced cancer diagnoses among certain populations as compared with others.
row.field_list_description: NCI is working to understand and address cancer health disparities, such as the higher cancer death rates, less frequent use of proven screening tests, and higher rates of advanced cancer diagnoses among certain populations as compared with others.

row.title: Cancer Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: Investigating the genetic foundations of cancer has improved our understanding of cancer biology and led to better prevention, diagnosis and treatment methods.
row.field_feature_card_description: Understanding the genetic foundations of cancer leads to new methods of diagnosing and treating the disease.
row.field_list_description: Investigating the genetic foundations of cancer has improved our understanding of cancer biology and led to new methods of diagnosing and treating the disease.

row.title: Global Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: NCI is confronting the global burden of cancer through many programs and international partnerships.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI is committed to supporting international programs and partnerships that drive progress against cancer worldwide.
row.field_list_description: NCI is confronting the global burden of cancer by creating sustainable international partnerships, supporting programs that address global gaps in research and scientific training, and disseminating information and best practices that drive improvements in cancer research and cancer control.

row.title: Public Health Research and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Population-based cancer research can provide important information that influences practices, policies, and programs that directly affect and could improve public health.
row.field_feature_card_description: Studying cancer and its burden on a population-wide scale can provide information that directly affects the health of millions of people.
row.field_list_description: Studying cancer and its burden on a population-wide scale can provide important information that influences practices, policies, and programs that directly affect the health of millions of people in the United States each year.
row.field_browser_title: Research Areas: Cancer and Public Health

row.title: Cancer Screening and Early Detection Research
row.field_short_title: Cancer Screening and Early Detection Research
row.field_page_description: Information about cancer screening and early detection research, including a summary of NCI programs dedicated to advancing screening and early detection.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI supports and directs research on screening and the early detection of cancer, including studies to develop and validate biological markers.
row.field_list_description: NCI supports and directs research on screening and the early detection of cancer, including studies to develop and validate biological markers.
row.field_browser_title: Research Areas: Screening and Early Detection
row.field_card_title: Cancer Screening and Early Detection Research

row.title: Cancer Treatment Research
row.field_page_description: The development of more-effective and less-toxic treatments is fundamental to improving outcomes for patients with cancer. NCI is leading efforts on several fronts to develop and evaluate new cancer treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI supports many efforts to develop more-effective, less-toxic treatments for cancer.
row.field_list_description: The development of more-effective and less-toxic treatments is fundamental to improving outcomes for patients with cancer. NCI is leading efforts on several fronts to develop and evaluate new cancer treatments.

row.title: Choices for Care When Treatment May Not Be an Option
row.field_page_description: Know your choices for cancer care when coping with advanced cancer. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and trying a clinical trial.
row.field_feature_card_description: When cancer treatment is no longer working, you still have choices for your care. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and clinical trials for advanced cancer.
row.field_list_description: When standard cancer treatment is no longer working, you still have choices for your care. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and clinical trials for advanced cancer.

row.title: Talking about Your Advanced Cancer
row.field_feature_card_description: Knowing your options and sharing them with others will make it easier for you to move forward with your care.

row.title: Coping with Your Feelings During Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Coping with Your Feelings During Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: There are many difficult feelings that you can have when going through cancer. Having an advanced or metastatic cancer diagnosis can cause them to be more intense than ever. Know that you're not alone. Learn tips on how to cope with your feelings with an advanced cancer diagnosis.
row.field_feature_card_description: There are many intense feelings that you can have when going through cancer. Know that you're not alone. Learn tips on coping with your emotions during advanced cancer.
row.field_list_description: There are many difficult feelings that you can have when going through cancer. row.title: Trial of Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this phase I clinical trial, HIV-positive patients receiving combination antiretroviral therapy who have cancer that has recurred after or has not responded to previous treatment will receive the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab.
row.field_feature_card_description: HIV-positive patients receiving combination antiretroviral therapy who have cancer that has recurred after or has not responded to previous treatment will receive pembrolizumab.
row.field_list_description: In this phase I clinical trial, HIV-positive patients receiving combination antiretroviral therapy who have cancer that has recurred after or has not responded to previous treatment will receive the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab.
row.field_browser_title: Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer
row.field_card_title: Pembrolizumab for HIV-Positive Patients with Recurrent or Refractory Cancer

row.title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Advanced Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Advanced Head and Neck
row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance had fewer operations but similar overall survival rates to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection.
row.field_feature_card_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance had fewer operations but similar overall survival rates to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection.
row.field_list_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance after chemoradiation had overall survival rates similar to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection and chemoradiation. But PET-CT imaging resulted in fewer operations and was more cost-effective than neck dissection.
row.field_browser_title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance of Head and Neck Cancers
row.field_card_title: Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Head and Neck

row.title: Clinical Trials Reporting Program
row.field_page_description: The Clinical Trials Reporting Program is a comprehensive database of all NCI-supported clinical trials.

row.field_list_description: A comprehensive database of all NCI-supported clinical trials. The database exists to identify gaps in clinical research and duplicative studies. row.title: Identifying Novel Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_short_title: Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_page_description: A review of current research identifying and testing drug combination approaches that have the potential to overcome or delay resistance to cancer treatment.
row.field_feature_card_description: Scientists are exploring drug combinations to overcome treatment resistance.
row.field_list_description: Drug resistance is a common occurrence that can lead to tumor relapse and patient death. Scientists are exploring combinations of different cancer drugs that have the potential to kill more cancer cells and overcome or delay drug resistance.

row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train physicians in aspects of drug, biologic, or device development and standards for assessing medical product safety. Learn more about this cancer training program.

row.title: Nivolumab Improves Survival for Patients with Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: Nivolumab for Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improved overall survival compared with standard chemotherapy in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
row.field_feature_card_description: In a phase III trial, the drug improved overall survival better than chemotherapy.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial showed that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improved overall survival compared with standard chemotherapy in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.

row.title: Daratumumab Improves Progression-Free Survival for Patients with Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Daratumumab for Multiple Myeloma Improves Progression-Free Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that daratumumab plus lenalidomide and dexamethasone improved progression-free survival for patients with relapsed or refractory disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Daratumumab plus lenalidomide and dexamethasone improved survival for patients with relapsed or refractory disease.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial showed that adding daratumumab to lenalidomide and dexamethasone improved progression-free survival among patients with relapsed or refractory disease, compared with lenalidomide and dexamethasone alone.

row.title: Screen to Save: NCI Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative
row.field_page_description: NCI Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates among ethnically and racially diverse and rural communities nationwide.
row.field_feature_card_description: Working through community health educators, this initiative aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates in racially and ethnically diverse and rural communities nationwide.
row.field_list_description: NCI Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates among ethnically and racially diverse and rural communities nationwide.
row.field_browser_title: Screen to Save - Colorectal Cancer Screening

row.title: Pembrolizumab Improves Survival for Some Patients with Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that pembrolizumab improved progression-free and overall survival for patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Pembrolizumab improved survival for patients with advanced disease.
row.field_list_description: Results from a phase III trial showed that the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) improved progression-free and overall survival among patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer compared with chemotherapy.
row.field_browser_title: Pembrolizumab for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_card_title: Pembrolizumab for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Improves Survival

row.title: National CryoEM Facility Acknowledged User Publications
row.field_short_title: Acknowledged Publications from National CryoEM Facility’s Users
row.field_page_description: The National CryoEM Facility provides cancer researchers access to the latest technology for high resolution imaging. View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users.
row.field_feature_card_description: View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users.
row.field_list_description: View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users. The National CryoEM Facility provides cancer researchers access to the latest technology for high resolution imaging.

row.title: TCGA Contact Information
row.field_page_description: Find contact information for The Cancer Genome Atlas Program.
row.field_list_description: For more information about The Cancer Genome Atlas program, reach out to a member of the team.

row.title: Teaching in Medical Education
row.field_page_description: The Teaching in Medical Education (TIME) course provides NCI postdoctoral fellows with basic knowledge in teaching methods, course planning, writing a syllabus and developing examinations. This course is for postdoctoral fellows interested in pursing an academic career at a medical school.
row.field_list_description: The Teaching in Medical Education (TIME) course provides NCI postdoctoral fellows with basic knowledge in teaching methods, course planning, writing a syllabus and developing examinations. This course is for postdoctoral fellows interested in pursing an academic career at a medical school.

row.title: Trichloroethylene (TCE)
row.field_page_description: Trichloroethylene (TCE) is a chemical used to make refrigerants and as a metal degreaser. It may be found in contaminated soil or water near military bases and in some commercial and household cleaning products. TCE exposure may cause kidney cancer and increase the risk of lymphoma and liver cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Trichloroethylene (TCE) is widely used as a degreasing agent and may accumulate in soil and groundwater near places it is used. TCE exposure may cause kidney cancer and increase the risk of lymphoma and liver cancer.
row.field_list_description: Learn about trichloroethylene (TCE), a chemical used to make refrigerants and as a degreaser. Exposure to TCE may cause kidney cancer and increase the risk of lymphoma and liver cancer. Although most TCE in the United States is used in manufacturing refrigerants, it may be found in contaminated soil or groundwater near military bases and in some commercial and household cleaning products.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Solid Tumors Anywhere in the Body
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Solid Tumors Anywhere in the Body
row.field_page_description: A list of cancer drugs approved by the FDA for the treatment of solid tumors.
row.field_list_description: A list of cancer drugs approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for for the treatment of solid tumors based on their genetic features and not on where the tumors originated in the body. The list includes generic names and brand names.
row.field_browser_title: Drugs Approved for Solid Tumors Anywhere in the Body
row.field_card_title: Drugs Approved for Solid Tumors Anywhere in the Body
row.meta_keywords: solid tumors, cancer drugs,

row.title: Statistical Analysis of Research Data
row.field_page_description: The Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD) course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview on the general principles of statistical analysis of research data.
row.field_feature_card_description: The Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD) course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview on the general principles of statistical analysis of research data.
row.field_list_description: The Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD) course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview on the general principles of statistical analysis of research data.

row.title: The Pathway to Independence Award for Outstanding Early Stage Postdoctoral Researchers (K99/R00)
row.field_page_description: The early K99/R00 will help researchers to complete n needed mentored training and transition in a timely manner to independent, tenure-track or equivalent.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Pathway to Independence Award for Outstanding Early Stage Postdoctoral Researchers (K99/R00) supports outstanding postdoctoral researchers who do not require extended periods of mentored research training beyond their doctoral degrees before transitioning to research independence, which is common for those working in data science and cancer control science.
row.meta_keywords: Independence, Outstanding, Postdoctoral, K99, R00, Early, Pathway

row.title: Join the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_short_title: Join the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board offers fellows a free, confidential scientific document-editing service and gives fellows who join the Board editorial training and experience. The Fellows Editoral Board is by volunteer only of fellows and other professionals to edit scientific documents and grant applications.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board offers fellows a free, confidential scientific document-editing service and gives fellows who join the Board editorial training and experience. The Fellows Editoral Board is by volunteer only of fellows and other professionals to edit scientific documents and grant applications.

row.field_card_title: Join the NIH Fellows Editorial Board

row.title: NIH Fellows Editorial Board Editorial Process Guidelines
row.field_page_description: Board members will review submitted documents following an editorial process and prepare final reports.
row.field_list_description: Board members will review submitted documents following an editorial process and prepare final reports.

row.title: Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI)
row.field_page_description: The Childhood Cancer Data Initiative focuses on the critical need to collect, analyze, and share data to address childhood cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: This initiative focuses on the critical need of obtaining and analyzing data from children with cancer.
row.field_list_description: The Childhood Cancer Data Initiative focuses on the critical need to collect, analyze, and share data to address the burden of childhood cancer. This initiative aims to make it easier for researchers to learn from each child with cancer.

row.title: Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) Symposium
row.field_page_description: Approximately 250 scientific stakeholders and leaders from academia, government, industry, and advocacy will gather in Washington, DC, July 29–31 for the NCI Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) Symposium.
row.field_feature_card_description: Approximately 250 scientific stakeholders and leaders from academia, government, industry, and advocacy will gather in Washington, DC, July 29–31 for the NCI Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) Symposium.
row.field_list_description: Approximately 250 scientific stakeholders and leaders from academia, government, industry, and advocacy will gather in Washington, DC, July 29–31 for the NCI Childhood Cancer Data Initiative (CCDI) Symposium—a scientific planning session to gain a common understanding of the current issues and opportunities in childhood cancer research that can be addressed through enhanced data collection and maximum utilization. Discussions will help inform the development of goals for the initiative.

row.title: Understanding Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Watch these videos to learn about some basic aspects of cancer clinical trials such as the different phases of clinical trials, methods used to protect patient safety, and how the costs of clinical trials are covered.
row.field_list_description: Watch these videos to learn about some basic aspects of cancer clinical trials such as the different phases of clinical trials, methods used to protect patient safety, and how the costs of clinical trials are covered.

row.title: Atlas del Genoma del Cáncer: Antecedentes

row.field_page_description: El Atlas del Genoma del Cáncer es una iniciativa de los Institutos Nacionales de la Salud (NIH) para crear mapas multidimensionales completos de los cambios genómicos clave en los tipos y subtipos principales de cáncer.
row.field_feature_card_description: El Atlas del Genoma del Cáncer es una iniciativa de los Institutos Nacionales de la Salud (NIH) para crear mapas multidimensionales completos de los cambios genómicos clave en los tipos y subtipos principales de cáncer.

row.title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival Compared with Ofatumumab in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared ibrutinib (Imbruvica®) and ofatumumab (Arzerra®) for the treatment of relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL).
row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) who were treated with ibrutinib (Imbruvica®) lived longer without their disease getting wo
row.field_list_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed or refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) who were treated with ibrutinib (Imbruvica®) lived longer without their disease getting worse than patients who received ofatumumab (Arzerra®). Patients who received ibrutinib also lived longer and were more likely to show a clinical response to treatment than those who received ofatumumab.
row.field_browser_title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_card_title: Ibrutinib Improves Survival in Patients with Previously Treated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.meta_keywords: ibrutinib, Imbruvica, ofatumumab, Arzerra, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, CLL, small lymphocytic lymphoma, SLL, John Byrd, Wyndham Wilson

row.title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared enzalutamide (Xtandi®) and placebo for the treatment of metastatic prostate cancer that had progressed during treatment with androgen deprivation therapy.
row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, the hormone therapy enzalutamide (Xtandi®) extended survival in men with metastatic prostate cancer that had progressed during treatment with androgen deprivation therapy. Participants in the trial
row.field_list_description: In an international randomized phase III clinical trial, the hormone therapy enzalutamide (Xtandi®) extended survival in men with metastatic prostate cancer that had progressed during treatment with androgen deprivation therapy. Participants in the trial had not received chemotherapy.
row.field_browser_title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_card_title: Enzalutamide Improves Survival in Patients with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.meta_keywords: enzalutamide, Xtandi, prostate cancer, castrate-resistant, hormone therapy, androgen deprivation therapy, Tomasz Beer, Bhupinder Mann

row.title: CRCHD Funding for Research and Training
row.field_page_description: CRCHD provides extramural research grants to researchers and institutions and training and career development funding opportunities to increase workforce diversity.
row.field_feature_card_description: Find the latest CRCHD funding opportunities for cancer and cancer health disparities research and training.
row.field_list_description: CRCHD provides extramural grants to researchers and institutions conducting research on cancer and cancer health disparities. CRCHD is committed to the training and development of a strong workforce of cancer researchers from diverse populations.
row.field_browser_title: CRCHD Funding for Research and Training

row.title: Aflatoxins
row.field_page_description: Learn about aflatoxins, a family of toxins associated with an increased risk of liver cancer. Aflatoxins are produced by certain fungi found on agricultural crops such as maize (corn), peanuts, cottonseed, and tree nuts.

row.title: CRCHD Mission
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) established the Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD) in 2001 to help reduce the unequal burden of cancer in our society.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI established CRCHD in 2001 to help reduce the unequal burden of cancer
row.field_list_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) established the Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities (CRCHD) in 2001 to help reduce the unequal burden of cancer in our society.

row.title: Wood Dust
row.field_page_description: Learn about wood dust, which can raise the risk of cancers of the paranasal sinuses and nasal cavity. High amounts of wood dust are produced in sawmills, and in the furniture-making, cabinet-making, and carpentry industries.
row.field_list_description: Learn about wood dust, which can raise the risk of cancers of the paranasal sinuses and nasal cavity. High amounts of wood dust are produced in sawmills, and in the furniture-making, cabinet-making, and carpentry industries.

row.title: Vinyl Chloride
row.field_page_description: Learn about vinyl chloride, which can raise the risk of a rare form of liver cancer, as well as brain and lung cancers, and leukemia and lymphoma. Vinyl chloride is used primarily to make PVC, a substance used in products such as pipes.
row.field_list_description: Learn about vinyl chloride, which can raise the risk of a rare form of liver cancer, as well as brain and lung cancers, and leukemia and lymphoma. Vinyl chloride is used primarily to make PVC, a substance used in products such as pipes.

row.title: Thorium
row.field_page_description: Learn about thorium, which can raise the risk of liver, lung, and pancreatic cancers. The primary ways people are exposed are inhalation, intravenous injection, ingestion, and absorption through the skin.
row.field_list_description: Learn about thorium, which can raise the risk of liver, lung, and pancreatic cancers. The primary ways people are exposed are inhalation, intravenous injection, ingestion, and absorption through the skin.

row.title: Soot
row.field_page_description: Learn about soot, which can raise the risk of scrotal and other skin cancers, as well as lung, esophageal, and bladder cancers. Soot is a byproduct of the burning of carbon-containing materials, such as wood, fuel oil, plastics, and household refuse. Chimney sweeps face the highest risk.
row.field_list_description: Learn about soot, which can raise the risk of scrotal and other skin cancers, as well as lung, esophageal, and bladder cancers

row.title: Strong Inorganic Acid Mists Containing Sulfuric Acid
row.field_short_title: Strong Inorganic Acid Mists Containing Sulfuric Acid
row.field_page_description: Copper smelting and other manufacturing processes generate strong inorganic acid mists that can increase your risk of laryngeal and lung cancers.
row.field_browser_title: Strong Inorganic Acid Mists Containing Sulfuric Acid - Cancer-Causing Substances
row.field_card_title: Strong Inorganic Acid Mists Containing Sulfuric Acid

row.title: Secondhand Tobacco Smoke (Environmental Tobacco Smoke)
row.field_page_description: Learn about secondhand tobacco smoke, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Secondhand tobacco smoke is the combination of the smoke given off by a burning tobacco product and the smoke exhaled by a smoker. Also called environmental tobacco smoke, involuntary smoke, and passive smoke.
row.field_browser_title: Secondhand Tobacco Smoke (Environmental Tobacco Smoke) - Cancer-Causing Substances

row.title: Radon
row.field_page_description: Learn about radon, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Radon gas usually exists at very low levels outdoors, but the gas can accumulate in areas without adequate ventilation, such as underground mines or residential basements.

row.title: Nickel Compounds
row.field_page_description: Learn about nickel compounds, which can raise your risk of lung cancer and nasal cancer. Workers in mining, smelting, welding, and other industrial occupations are most commonly exposed to nickel.

row.title: Indoor Emissions from the Household Combustion of Coal
row.field_short_title: Indoor Emissions from the Household Combustion of Coal
row.field_page_description: Learn about the lung cancer risk associated with burning coal inside your home. Indoor emissions from the household combustion of coal contain harmful chemicals such as benzene, carbon monoxide, and formaldehyde.
row.field_browser_title: Indoor Emissions from the Household Combustion of Coal - Cancer-Causing Substances
row.field_card_title: Indoor Emissions from the Household Combustion of Coal

row.title: Mineral Oils: Untreated and Mildly Treated
row.field_short_title: Mineral Oils: Untreated and Mildly Treated
row.field_page_description: Learn about mineral oils, which can raise the risk of nonmelanoma skin cancer, particularly of the scrotum. Workers in a variety of manufacturing industries are most commonly exposed to mineral oils, as are workers in engine repair, copper mining, and commercial printing.
row.field_browser_title: Mineral Oils: Untreated and Mildly Treated - Cancer-Causing Substances
row.field_card_title: Mineral Oils: Untreated and Mildly Treated

row.title: Hexavalent Chromium Compounds
row.field_page_description: Learn about chromium, exposure to which can increase your risk of lung cancer and cancer of the paranasal sinuses and nasal cavity. Hexavalent chromium compounds have been used as corrosion inhibitors in a wide variety of products and processes.

row.title: Formaldehyde
row.field_page_description: Learn about formaldehyde, which can raise your risk of myeloid leukemia and rare cancers of or near the nasal cavity. Formaldehyde is used in pressed-wood building materials, fungicides, germicides, disinfectants, and certain preservatives. Other sources include tobacco smoke and car emissions.

row.title: Ethylene Oxide
row.field_page_description: Learn about ethylene oxide, which can raise your risk of lymphoma and leukemia. Exposure may occur through industrial emissions, tobacco smoke, and the use of products sterilized with ethylene oxide, such as certain medical products or cosmetics.

row.title: Aristolochic Acids
row.field_page_description: Learn about aristolochic acids, which may increase your risk of bladder cancer and cancers of the upper urinary tract (renal pelvis and ureter). Aristolochic acids are found naturally in many types of plants, some of which are used in herbal products marketed as dietary supplements.

row.title: Erionite
row.field_page_description: Learn about erionite, which can raise your risk of lung cancer and mesothelioma. Erionite is a a naturally occurring fibrous mineral. Erionite-related disease has been reported most often among road construction and maintenance workers.

row.title: Arsenic
row.field_page_description: Arsenic is a naturally occurring substance that can be found in air, water, and soil and is known to cause cancer. Inorganic arsenic is naturally present at high levels in the groundwater of certain countries, including the United States.
row.field_list_description: Arsenic is a naturally occurring substance that can be found in air, water, and soil and is known to cause cancer. Inorganic arsenic is naturally present at high levels in the groundwater of certain countries, including the United States.

row.title: Asbestos
row.field_page_description: Asbestos are a group of naturally occurring fibrous minerals used in fire-resistant and insulating material. Breathing high levels of asbestos can cause several diseases, including lung cancer and malignant mesothelioma. The use of asbestos is now highly regulated in the United States.
row.field_list_description: Asbestos are a group of naturally occurring fibrous minerals used in fire-resistant and insulating material. Breathing high levels of asbestos can cause several diseases, including lung cancer and malignant mesothelioma. The use of asbestos is now highly regulated in the United States.

row.title: Benzene
row.field_page_description: Learn about benzene, a component of crude oil and other substances. Exposure to benzene may increase the risk of leukemia and other blood disorders. Among smokers, 90 percent of benzene exposure comes from smoking. Benzene may also be found in glues, adhesives, and paint or cleaning products.

row.title: Benzidine
row.field_page_description: Learn about benzidine, exposure to which raises your risk of bladder cancer. Benzidine is a manufactured chemical. In the past, benzidine was used to produce dyes or products used in clinical laboratories. However, benzidine has not been sold in the United States since the mid-1970s.
row.meta_keywords: benzidine, causes of cancer, cancers caused by benzidine

row.title: Beryllium
row.field_page_description: Learn about beryllium, exposure to which can increase your risk of lung cancer. Beryllium is a naturally occurring, light-weight metal used in products such as aerospace components, transistors, nuclear reactors, and golf clubs. Most exposures occur to workers who produce such products.

row.title: 1,3-Butadiene
row.field_page_description: Learn about 1,3-butadiene, exposure to which can raise your risk of leukemia. 1,3-Butadiene is a gas used to produce synthetic rubber products, such as tires, resins, and plastics. Other sources of exposure include car exhaust; tobacco smoke; and polluted air and water near industrial facilities.

row.title: Cadmium
row.field_page_description: Learn about cadmium, which may raise your risk of lung cancer. Cadmium is a natural element: all soils and rocks contain some cadmium. Exposure occurs mostly where cadmium products (such as batteries, pigments, metal coatings, and plastics) are made or recycled. Tobacco smoke also contains cadmium.

row.title: Coal Tar and Coal-Tar Pitch
row.field_page_description: Learn about coal-tar products, which can raise your risk of skin cancer, lung cancer, and other types of cancer. Examples of coal-tar products include creosote, coal-tar pitch, and certain preparations used to treat skin conditions such as eczema, psoriasis, and dandruff.
row.field_browser_title: Coal Tar and Coal-Tar Pitch - Cancer-Causing Substances

row.title: Coke Oven Emissions
row.field_page_description: Learn about coke oven emissions, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Workers at coking plants and coal-tar production plants may be exposed to coke oven emissions.

row.title: Crystalline Silica
row.field_page_description: Learn about crystalline silica (quartz dust), which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Crystalline silica is present in certain construction materials such as concrete, masonry, and brick and also in commercial products such as some cleansers, cosmetics, pet litter, talcum powder, caulk, and paint.

row.title: Cancer-Causing Substances in the Environment
row.field_page_description: This page lists substances that may cause or contribute to the development of cancer, depending on amount of exposure, an individual's genetic background, and other factors.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about some of the most likely carcinogens to affect human health.
row.field_list_description: This page lists substances that may cause or contribute to the development of cancer, depending on amount of exposure, an individual's genetic background, and other factors.

row.title: Understanding Prostate Changes: A Health Guide for Men
row.field_page_description: Prostate changes and symptoms that are not cancer. Learn about symptoms, risk factors, and treatment for prostatitis, enlarged prostate (BPH), prostate cancer. Talk with doctor about prostate cancer screening tests (DRE, PSA), biopsy, and Gleason score.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about symptoms, risk factors, and treatment for prostatitis, enlarged prostate (BPH), and prostate cancer.
row.field_list_description: Learn about symptoms, risk factors, and treatment for prostatitis, enlarged prostate (BPH), and prostate cancer. Talk with doctor about prostate cancer screening tests, getting a biopsy, and what your Gleason score means.

row.field_list_description: The Journal of the National Cancer Institute was created by the NCI in the 1940s, but is no longer published by or affiliated with the Institute.

row.field_card_title: JNCI, Published by Oxford University Press, Is Not Affiliated With NCI

row.title: Nivolumab Improves Overall Survival in Patients with Metastatic Melanoma without a BRAF Mutation
row.field_short_title: Nivolumab for Metastatic Melanoma without a BRAF Mutation
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial show that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improves overall survival compared with the chemotherapy drug dacarbazine in patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors do not have a mutation in the BRAF gene.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from an international phase III trial show that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improves overall survival compared with the chemotherapy drug dacarbazine in patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors do not have a mutation in the BRAF gene.
row.field_list_description: Results from an international phase III trial show that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improves overall survival compared with the chemotherapy drug dacarbazine in patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors do not have a mutation in the BRAF gene.
row.field_browser_title: Nivolumab for Metastatic Melanoma without a BRAF Mutation
row.field_card_title: Nivolumab for Metastatic Melanoma without a BRAF Mutation
row.meta_keywords: nivolumab, Opdivo, dacarbazine, melanoma, BRAF, CheckMate-066, PD-L1, Caroline Robert, Howard Streicher

row.title: Combining Two Types of Targeted Therapy Improves Survival in Some Patients with Advanced Melanoma (Updated)
row.field_short_title: Dabrafenib Plus Trametinib for Advanced Melanoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from two phase III trials show that patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors have specific mutations in the BRAF gene lived longer following treatment with dabrafenib (Tafinlar®), a BRAF inhibitor, plus trametinib (Mekinist®), a
row.field_feature_card_description: In two phase III trials, patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors have specific mutations in the BRAF gene lived longer following treatment with dabrafenib (Tafinlar®), a BRAF inhibitor, plus trametinib (Mekinist®), a MEK inhibitor, than following t
row.field_list_description: In two phase III trials, patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors have specific mutations in the BRAF gene lived longer following treatment with dabrafenib (Tafinlar®), a BRAF inhibitor, plus trametinib (Mekinist®), a MEK inhibitor, than following treatment with a BRAF inhibitor alone.
row.field_browser_title: Dabrafenib Plus Trametinib for Advanced Melanoma
row.field_card_title: Dabrafenib Plus Trametinib for Advanced Melanoma
row.meta_keywords: dabrafenib, Tafinlar, trametinib, Mekinist, melanoma, BRAF, MEK, PD-L1, Caroline Robert, Georgina Long, Howard Streicher

row.title: Seeking Cancer Clues in Blood, Researchers Explore Exosomes
row.field_short_title: Seeking Cancer Clues in Blood, Researchers Explore Exosomes
row.field_page_description: A feature-length Research Update article about exploring ways to use vesicles known as exosomes to develop new clinical tests and tools for patients with cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers are using vesicles called exosomes to gain insights into cancer and to develop clinical tools for patients.
row.field_list_description: Researchers are exploring ways to use vesicles called exosomes to gain insights into cancer and to develop clinical tools for patients.

row.field_page_description: A four-day seminar to help U.S.-based journalists increase their understanding of scientific research and ability to report accurately on complex scientific findings.

row.title: Outcomes & Impact of The Cancer Genome Atlas
row.field_page_description: TCGA has changed our understanding of cancer, how research is conducted, how the disease is treated in the clinic, and more. Learn about the impact of the TCGA program.

row.title: By-Laws for the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board (FEB) offers a free and confidential editorial service for NIH fellows. The Board members edit manuscripts, abstracts, book chapters, clinical protocols, and grant submissions and offer suggestions for grammar, structure, and style, but not for scientific content.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board (FEB) offers a free and confidential editorial service for NIH fellows. The Board members edit manuscripts, abstracts, book chapters, clinical protocols, and grant submissions and offer suggestions for grammar, structure, and style, but not for scientific content. The Board provides valuable training and editorial experience to its members for academic as well as nonacademic scientific careers.

row.title: Submissions to the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_short_title: Submissions to the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_page_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board offers a free, confidential scientific document-editing service for any current NIH or FDA fellow. The all-volunteer Editorial Board of fellows and other professionals edit fellows’ scientific documents—typically manuscripts and grant applications—for grammar, form, and clarity. The editors also review essential elements pertinent to the document, such as figures and figure legends, but do not consider scientific merit.
row.field_list_description: The NIH Fellows Editorial Board offers a free, confidential scientific document-editing service for any current NIH or FDA fellow. The all-volunteer Editorial Board of fellows and other professionals edit fellows’ scientific documents—typically manuscripts and grant applications—for grammar, form, and clarity. The editors also review essential elements pertinent to the document, such as figures and figure legends, but do not consider scientific merit.
row.field_browser_title: Submissions to the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
row.field_card_title: Submissions to the NIH Fellows Editorial Board

row.title: Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers
row.field_page_description: The Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers workshop assist and inform NCI Fellows, Staff Scientists, and Staff Clinicians about exploring various science-based career opportunities outside of independent academic research. This 7 week workshop will provide best practices for getting a job, setting work expectations and navigating unique business-oriented scientific cultures.

row.title: Cancer Biotechnology
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Biotechnology course educates NCI fellows on new methodologies focusing on the latest advances in DNA, protein and image analysis. This course is targeted to clinical and postdoctoral fellows who want to learn about new biotechnology advances in science.
row.field_list_description: The Cancer Biotechnology course educates NCI fellows on new methodologies focusing on the latest advances in DNA, protein and image analysis. This course is targeted to clinical and postdoctoral fellows who want to learn about new biotechnology advances in science.

row.title: Non-Academic Jobs for Fellows in Law Firms, Patent and Trademark Office and Scientific Intellectual Property
row.field_page_description: The Non-Academic Jobs for Fellows in Law Firms, Patent and Trademark Office and Scientific Intellectual Property workshop assists NCI Fellows, Staff Scientists, and Staff Clinicians in positioning themselves for job opportunites.
row.field_list_description: The Non-Academic Jobs for Fellows in Law Firms, Patent and Trademark Office and Scientific Intellectual Property workshop assists NCI Fellows, Staff Scientists, and Staff Clinicians in positioning themselves for job opportunites at law firms, patent and trademark, and intellectual property protection across the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries.

row.title: Redox Biology
row.field_page_description: The Redox Biology course provides NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows with an overview of how redox-active species and radicals are generated, their effects on the cellular and physiological level, and how they alter carcinogenesis, angiogenesis and proliferation in animal models of cancer.
row.field_list_description: The Redox Biology course provides NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows with an overview of how redox-active species and radicals are generated, their effects on the cellular and physiological level, and how they alter carcinogenesis, angiogenesis and proliferation in animal models of cancer.

row.title: Scientific Management Training
row.field_page_description: The Scientific Management Training (SMT) course provides management skills to NCI Principal Investigators and NCI Fellows focusing on personnel and project management to assist in succesfully leading scientific research laboratories.
row.field_list_description: The Scientific Management Training (SMT) course provides management skills to NCI Principal Investigators and NCI Fellows focusing on personnel and project management to assist in succesfully leading scientific research laboratories.

row.title: Statistical Tutorial
row.field_page_description: The Statistical Tutorial (ST) course is designed as a follow up to the Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD). This tutorial will apply real-time general principles of statistical analysis of research data.
row.field_list_description: The Statistical Tutorial (ST) course is designed as a follow up to the Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD). This tutorial will apply real-time general principles of statistical analysis of research data including descriptive statistics, z- and t-tests of means and mean differences, simple and multiple linear regression, ANOVA tests, and Chi-Squared distribution.

row.title: K Grant Writing Workshop
row.field_page_description: The K Grant Writing Workshop focuses on how to write clear and persuasive grant applications. This course aims to increase the quality of grant applications by successfully communicating scientific data and ideas.
row.field_list_description: K Grant Writing Workshop focuses on how to write clear and persuasive grant applications. This course aims to increase the quality of grant applications by successfully communicating scientific data and ideas.

row.title: CCR Fellows and Young Investigators Association
row.field_page_description: The Fellows and Young Investigators Association enhances the intramural training program by organizing, promoting and informing the NCI fellows of career development and training opportunities at the NIH. row.title: Translational Research in Clinical Oncology
row.field_page_description: This course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview of general principles of cancer biology and treatment, epidemiology, genomics, precision medicine, mechanisms of resistance, use of preclinical models, and identification of novel molecular targets.
row.field_list_description: The Translational Research in Clinical Oncology (TRACO) course is designed to provide NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows an overview of general principles of cancer biology and treatment, epidemiology, genomics, precision medicine, mechanisms of resistance, use of preclinical models, and identification of novel molecular targets.

row.title: Director’s Innovation Award Program
row.field_page_description: The NCI Director’s Innovation Award Program is designed to support development of highly innovative approaches and technology aimed at significant problems from across the CCR portfolio.

row.title: Modeling and Druggable-Genome Screening of Glioblastoma Invasion Using Regional Biopsy-Guided Biomaterials Systems
row.field_short_title: Modeling and Druggable-Genome Screening of Glioblastoma Invasion
row.field_page_description: TEC funded grant which will uncover mechanisms by which glioblastoma tumor cells and their microenvironment are altered to drive increased invasiveness as cells migrate away from the tumor core.
row.field_list_description: This TEC funded grant has combined site-directed biopsies from GBM with tissue engineered platforms to study invasion in vitro. Our studies will uncover mechanisms by which tumor cells and their microenvironment are altered to drive increased invasiveness as cells migrate away from the tumor core.
row.field_card_title: Modeling and Druggable-Genome Screening of Glioblastoma Invasion

row.title: PSA Velocity Does Not Improve Prostate Cancer Detection
row.field_short_title: PSA Velocity Does Not Improve Prostate Cancer Detection
row.field_page_description: A rapid increase in prostate-specific antigen (PSA) levels is not grounds for automatically recommending a prostate biopsy, according to a study published online February 24, 2011, in the Journal of the National Cancer Institute.

row.field_feature_card_description: The biological agent denosumab is more effective than zoledronic acid at decreasing the risk of bone fractures in men with castration-resistant metastatic prostate cancer, according to results from a randomized trial.

row.title: Sentinel Lymph Node Occult Metastases Have Minimal Survival Effect in Node-Negative Breast Cancer Patients
row.field_short_title: Sentinel Lymph Node Occult Metastases Have Minimal Survival Effect in Some Breast Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Detailed examination of sentinel lymph node tissue from breast cancer patients revealed previously unidentified metastases in about 16% of the samples, but the difference in 5-year survival between patients with and without these metastases was very small
row.field_feature_card_description: Detailed examination of sentinel lymph node tissue from breast cancer patients revealed previously unidentified metastases in about 16% of the samples, but the difference in 5-year survival between patients with and without these metastases was very small
row.field_list_description: Detailed examination of sentinel lymph node tissue from breast cancer patients revealed previously unidentified metastases in about 16% of the samples, but the difference in 5-year survival between patients with and without these metastases was very small and likely not clinically meaningful. The results were published in the February 3, 2011 New England Journal of Medicine.

row.field_card_title: Combining Chemotherapy with Bevacizumab Improves Outcomes for Ovarian Cancer Patients

row.title: Adding Targeted Therapy to Treatment for Esophageal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Adding Targeted Therapy to Treatment for Esophageal Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab.
row.field_feature_card_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab.
row.field_list_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab. Following surgery, patients assigned to the trastuzumab arm of the study will receive maintenance therapy with trastuzumab for 1 year.
row.field_browser_title: Adding Targeted Therapy to Treatment for Esophageal Cancer
row.field_card_title: Adding Targeted Therapy to Treatment for Esophageal Cancer
row.meta_keywords: trastuzumab, Herceptin, esophagus, esophageal, radiation, surgery, paclitaxel, carboplatin, Taxol, Paraplat, Paraplatin

row.title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_short_title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_page_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.
row.field_feature_card_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.

row.title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_short_title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_page_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.
row.field_feature_card_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.
row.field_list_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane (Aromasin®)—commonly used to treat early and advanced-stage breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in postmenopausal women at high risk of developing the disease.

row.title: Abiraterone Improves Survival in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Abiraterone Improves Survival in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A multinational phase III trial found that the drug abiraterone acetate prolonged the median survival of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer by 4 months compared with patients who received a placebo.

row.title: Appetite Loss and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments may lower your appetite. Side effects such as nausea, fatigue, or mouth sores can also making eating difficult. Learn how to eat well to avoid losing weight or becoming dehydrated, so you stay strong during treatment.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes appetite loss, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage it.

row.title: Bleeding and Bruising (Thrombocytopenia) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments, such as chemotherapy and targeted therapy, can increase patients’ risk of bleeding and bruising, also called thrombocytopenia. Learn about steps to take if you are at increased risk of a low platelet count.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes bleeding and bruising, a side effect of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage it.
row.meta_keywords: bleeding, bruising, thrombocytopenia, side effects, people with cancer, targeted therapy, chemotherapy treatment, low platelet count

row.title: Nausea and Vomiting in People with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Types of nausea and vomiting caused by cancer treatment include: anticipatory, acute, and delayed. Controlling these side effects will help to prevent serious problems such as malnutrition and dehydration in people with cancer.
row.field_list_description: Information about what causes nausea and vomiting, side effects of some cancer treatments, and ways to manage it.
row.meta_keywords: nausea, vomiting, anticipatory, acute, delayed, cancer side effects

row.title: About This Website

row.title: NCI's Genome Characterization Pipeline
row.field_page_description: The Genome Characterization Pipeline, run by NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics, transforms cancer tissue samples into rich genomic datasets that are shared with the research community.
row.field_feature_card_description: This efficient workflow transforms cancer tissue samples into rich, publicly available genomic and clinical data. CCG partners with expert research teams to produce and share high quality, harmonized raw and processed data with researchers worldwide.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Genome Characterization Pipeline is an efficient workflow that transforms cancer tissue samples into rich, publicly available genomic and clinical data. By partnering with foremost experts in tissue processing, bioinformatics, and data science, CCG produces and shares high quality, harmonized raw and processed data with researchers worldwide.
