row.title: Combination of Idelalisib and Rituximab Improves Survival in Patients with Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Idelalisib Plus Rituximab for Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international double-blind phase III trial that compared the combination of idelalisib plus rituximab (Rituxan®) versus placebo plus rituximab.
row.field_feature_card_description: In an international randomized double-blind phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who received the investigational drug idelalisib in combination with rituximab (Rituxan®) lived substantially longer without th
row.field_list_description:
In an international randomized double-blind phase III clinical trial, patients with relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who received the investigational drug idelalisib in combination with rituximab (Rituxan®) lived substantially longer without their disease getting worse than patients who received a placebo plus rituximab.
Overall survival was also improved in patients who received idelalisib plus rituximab. Patients who received idelalisib and rituximab were also more likely to live 12 months after beginning treatment and to have their cancer regress compared with patients who received a placebo plus rituximab.
row.field_browser_title: Idelalisib Plus Rituximab for Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_card_title: Idelalisib Plus Rituximab for Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.meta_keywords: chronic lymphocytic leukemia, CLL, idelalisib, rituximab, Rituxan, Richard Furman, Richard Little

row.title: Treatment of Solid Tumor Cancers with the Chemotherapy Drug Methotrexate
row.field_page_description: Prior to the 1950s, treatment for the majority of cancers was limited to either surgery or the use of radiation. The discovery of the use of methotrexate in curing a rare cancer marked the first time a cancer had been cured. This led to the development of many of today’s common cancer treatments.
row.field_list_description: Prior to the 1950s, treatment for the majority of cancers was limited to either surgery or the use of radiation. The discovery of the use of methotrexate in curing a rare cancer marked the first time a cancer had been cured. This led to the development of many of today’s common cancer treatments.
row.field_browser_title: Discovery – Methotrexate: Chemotherapy Treatment for Cancer
row.meta_keywords: Basic research, methotrexate, chemotherapy, cancer treatment, solid tumor

row.title: Training Providers and Patients to Talk about End-of-Life Care
row.field_short_title: Training Providers and Patients to Talk about End-of-Life Care
row.field_page_description: Failing to discuss the transition from active cancer treatment to end-of-life care can leave doctors unsure of what a patient truly wants. Failing to receive end-of-life care in line with their values and wishes can cause patients and their families great distress. Researchers have developed innovative, evidence-based programs to help doctors and patients improve their communication skills and grow comfortable with these discussions.
row.field_feature_card_description: An article about innovative, evidence-based programs to help doctors and patients discuss the transition from active cancer treatment to end-of-life care.

row.field_page_description: When researchers discovered the HER2 gene's importance to breast cancer growth, this led to the development of trastuzumab and other treatments that have improved survival for women with HER2-positive breast cancer.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about the development of trastuzumab and other treatments that have improved survival for women with HER2-positive breast cancer.
row.field_list_description: HER2 is a gene that has been linked to breast cancer growth. Learn about the development of trastuzumab, a monoclonal antibody that blocks the HER2 protein, and other treatments that have improved survival for women with HER2-positive breast cancer.

row.title: Adding Chemotherapy to Hormone Therapy Extends Overall Survival in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Hormone Therapy Plus Chemotherapy for Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A trial of androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) plus six cycles of docetaxel versus ADT alone found that after a median follow-up of nearly 29 months, median overall survival was 13.6 months longer with the combination therapy than with ADT alone.
row.field_feature_card_description: Hormone therapy plus chemotherapy extends overall survival compared with hormone therapy alone in men with metastatic prostate cancer.
row.field_list_description: Adding the chemotherapy drug docetaxel to hormone therapy extended median overall survival by 13.6 months compared with hormone therapy alone in men with metastatic prostate cancer.
row.field_browser_title: Hormone Therapy Plus Chemotherapy for Metastatic Prostate Cancer

row.title: Enhancing Drug Discovery and Development
row.field_page_description: Cancer drug discovery and development has long been a priority for the National Cancer Institute, most importantly in areas of need that are not being adequately addressed by the private sector.
row.field_list_description: Cancer drug discovery and development has long been a priority for the National Cancer Institute, most importantly in areas of need that are not being adequately addressed by the private sector.

row.title: Bioinformatics, Big Data, and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers take on challenges and opportunities to mine big data for answers to complex biological questions. Learn how bioinformatics uses advanced computing, mathematics, and technological platforms to store, manage, analyze, and understand data.
row.field_feature_card_description: Researchers take on challenges and opportunities to mine big data for answers to complex biological questions.
row.field_list_description: The focus of bioinformatics is to establish an infrastructure to store, analyze, integrate, and visualize large amounts of biological data and related information—big data—as well as provide access to it.

row.title: Genomic Data Commons
row.field_page_description: The NCI Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes data sharing and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_feature_card_description: This NCI-supported knowledge system for cancer genomic and clinical data fosters precision medicine in oncology.
row.field_list_description: NCI’s Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes sharing of genomic and clinical data between researchers and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.

row.title: Learning to Relax

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Blue Ribbon Panel
row.field_page_description: The Blue Ribbon Panel Report outlines 10 recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer. The panel was established to ensure that the Cancer Moonshot's approaches are grounded in the best science.

row.field_list_description: A Blue Ribbon Panel of experts was established as a working group of the NCAB to ensure that the Cancer Moonshot's approaches are grounded in the best science. Their report outlines 10 recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer.

row.title: NCI’s Role in Immunotherapy Research
row.field_page_description: Advances in cancer immunotherapy are the result of several decades of basic research, much of it supported by NCI, on how the immune system responds to cancer. Learn how NCI continues to support a wide range of research, from basic research to clinical trials, to advance the field of cancer immunotherapy.

row.title: Prevention and Early Detection of Hereditary Cancers

row.title: Low-Dose Radioactive Iodine Destroys Thyroid Tissue Left after Surgery
row.field_short_title: Low-Dose Radioactive Iodine Destroys Thyroid Tissue Left after Surgery
row.field_page_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two randomized controlled trials.
row.field_feature_card_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two randomized controlled trials.
row.field_list_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two European randomized controlled trials published May 3, 2012 in the New England Journal of Medicine.

row.title: For Some Breast Cancers, New Drug May Be Treatment Option
row.field_short_title: For Some Breast Cancers, New Drug May Be Treatment Option
row.field_page_description: Results from an international clinical trial suggest that women with metastatic, HER2-positive breast cancer that is no longer responding to the targeted therapy trastuzumab (Herceptin) may soon have a new treatment option.
row.field_feature_card_description: Results from an international clinical trial suggest that women with metastatic, HER2-positive breast cancer that is no longer responding to the targeted therapy trastuzumab (Herceptin) may soon have a new treatment option.
row.field_list_description: Results from an international clinical trial suggest that women with metastatic, HER2-positive breast cancer that is no longer responding to the targeted therapy trastuzumab (Herceptin) may soon have a new treatment option. Women who received the investigational drug trastuzumab emtansine (T-DM1) lived more than 3 months longer without their tumors progressing than women who received the chemotherapy drug capecitabine (Xeloda) and the targeted drug lapatinib (Tykerb).

row.field_page_description: Approval from NIH may be required before a cancer research grant recipient makes budget modifications or undertakes particular activities. Learn how to request approval.
row.field_feature_card_description: Prior written approval from NIH may be required before modifying grant budget or activities.
row.field_list_description: The recipient institution is permitted some flexibility for rebudgeting between budget categories, but some actions require prior approval from the NCI. Requests must be submitted at least 30 days before the proposed change.

row.title: Monitoring Research Grant Awards
row.field_page_description: NCI grants management staff regularly monitor individual grants within each budget period and within the overall project period.
row.field_feature_card_description: Monitoring grant awards requires ongoing analysis.
row.field_list_description: NCI grants management and program staff monitor individual grants within each budget period and within the overall project period.

row.title: Annual Reporting and Auditing
row.field_page_description: Reporting helps ensure desired results are achieved throughout the grants lifecycle. Learn more about reporting and auditing requirements for cancer research grants.
row.field_feature_card_description: Recipients must submit a variety of reports throughout the award lifecycle.
row.field_list_description: Recipients must submit a variety of reports during the lifecycle of a grant award. Report types may include the research performance progress report, invention report, and financial progress report.
row.field_browser_title: Annual Reporting and Auditing for Research Grants

row.title: Transfer of a Grant
row.field_page_description: NIH prior approval is required for the transfer of a grant. Learn more about transferring a cancer research grant from one entity to another.
row.field_feature_card_description: Prior approval is required for the transfer of a grant.
row.field_list_description: A change of recipient organization may be accomplished under most NIH grants, including construction grants. NIH prior approval is required to transfer a grant-supported project or activity from one entity to another.
